availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph T. Lokey (Brown County, Ohio, harness maker )

body.p: Brown County, Ohio, harness maker. Ohio native. Harness maker in Worcester County, Maryland in 1860. Harness maker in Brown County, Ohio in 1863. Enlisted in the Regular Army in Baltimore Maryland on October 9, 1860. Reported as "deserted" on October 10, 1860. Served in the 12th Ohio Volunteer Infantry as a private from April 1861 to August 1861. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry. Served in the 11th Ohio Volunteer Cavalry as private from February 1864 to September 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Maryland, Worcester County, p. 508
Register of Enlistments in the U.S. Army, 1798-1914 (National Archives Microfilm Publication M233, 81 rolls); Records of the Adjutant General’s Office, 1780’s-1917, Record Group 94; National Archives, Washington, D.C., p. 10
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Brown County, OH, August 1863, p. 173, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Official Roster of the Soldiers of the State of Ohio in the War of the Rebellion, 1861-1866 Vol. 1 (Akron: The Werner Company, 1893), 272.
Official Roster of the Soldiers of the State of Ohio in the War of the Rebellion, 1861-1866 Vol. 11 (Akron: The Werner Company, 1891), 571.
